image.altText: A corpse flower in full bloom.

props.synopsis: The corpse flower at the Australian National Botanic Gardens is at least 15 years old but had never flowered before now.

title.children: 'Smells like dead rat': Corpse flower blooms in Canberra after 15-year wait

image.altText: GettyImages-515649308

props.synopsis: Three decades after the first ordinations of women to the Anglican priesthood, women are still struggling to gain and maintain strong footholds on the rungs of leadership.

title.children: A year ago, Lynda looked around her church. What she found disturbed her

image.altText: Cameron Myers celebrates

props.synopsis: Australian Cameron Myers has continued his flying start to 2025 with a record-breaking performance in the Wanamaker Mile in the US.

title.children: Canberra teenager Myers smashes world under-20 mile record

image.altText: Eastern brown snake beside a stone wall.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of snakes are moved from backyards, inside homes and other urban areas into reserves and bushland around Canberra each year — but until now, little has been known about what happens to snakes after they’re released.

title.children: Snakes become 'very disoriented', lose weight and get sick when relocated

image.altText: Close up of actress Charlize Theron with short blonde hair

props.synopsis: There is an "unprecedented" level of filming activity across the Canberra region at the moment, with Hollywood stars Eric Bana, Charlize Theron and Taron Egerton all in town.

title.children: Charlize Theron in Canberra amid 'unprecedented' level of screen production activity

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flag.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor accused of sexually assaulting four young women will walk from custody next week, on the condition he is not left alone with any female staff or patients.

title.children: Canberra doctor accused of sexually assaulting four young women gets bail

image.altText: A painting of Rachael Gunn breaking hung on a white gallery wall.

props.synopsis: If there was one notable figure who was going to be parodied in art at this year's Bald Archy, it was always going to be Raygun, whose infamous breakdancing performance at the Paris Olympic Games featured in five entrants' works.

title.children: From Raygun to Dutton, no-one is immune from the satire of the Bald Archy brush

image.altText: Jordan Mailata shouts as he is surrounded by confetti after winning the Super Bowl.

props.synopsis: The Philadelphia Eagles dominate two-time defending champions Kansas City, winning Super Bowl LIX 40-22 to give Australian Jordan Mailata an NFL championship ring.

title.children: Australian Jordan Mailata wins Super Bowl as Eagles take down Chiefs

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Day one of the corporate watchdog's case against Star Entertainment has begun in a Sydney court. Former directors and executives face allegations they enabled conduct including dodging security cameras, bringing in cash in esky bags, and hiding the use of Chinese debit cards from National Australia Bank at its Sydney and Brisbane casinos.

title.children: Star casino executives accused of allowing 'illicit' activity to occur

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: We are watching the demise of a political system where the two major parties once relied on "safe" seats and fought elections in marginal seats that would swing between them.

title.children: We're watching the demise of the two-party system in real time

image.altText: Rows of newly built houses in a suburb.

props.synopsis: If predictions come true it will be another year of deteriorating housing affordability, prices will rise at twice the rate of disposable income — something that that has been going on for 25 years and has created what we all see now as a crisis.

title.children: The fundamental problem with housing in Australia

image.altText: The fascination that many Australians appear to have with the case of the missing Beaumont children is ethically fraught, as is the media's coverage of it.

props.synopsis: A former factory site linked to the 59-year-old the disappearance of the Beaumont children, which remains one of the nation's most baffling and tragic cold cases, will be searched a third time before being put up for sale, an SA MP says.

title.children: Beaumont children dig prompted by 'new information' about site linked to mystery

image.altText: people getting off the metro bus

props.synopsis: Public transport patronage is up nearly 20 per cent since the launch of 50c fares, new data shows.

title.children: Queensland's 50c fares have hit the six-month mark. Here's the verdict

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: A legal battle between Star Entertainment and the corporate regulator heads to Federal Court. Hong Kong investors are circling Star's stake in the Queen's Wharf casino complex. The ASX falls as Donald Trump flags further tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Star confirms Brisbane casino bid as former directors face court

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: WiseTech tumbles on new allegations of misconduct by founder Richard White
Aluminium industry responds to Donald Trump's tariff announcement

image.altText: A large wave washes over a jetty as dark clouds loom in the background.

props.synopsis: The monsoon finally arrives in northern Australia, bringing cool relief for some but more unwelcome rain for north Queensland amid unsettled weather across the country.

title.children: A week of unsettled weather in Australia as monsoon officially begins

image.altText: A side view of Bryan Adams playing guitar on stage

props.synopsis: Fans are left outraged amid “poor communication” after a sold-out Bryan Adams concert was cancelled hours after it was scheduled to start due to a water blockage outside Perth Arena.

title.children: Fans fuming after fatberg forced cancellation of Bryan Adams' Perth show

image.altText: A long shot of people carry the coffin in front of the Aga Khan mausoleum Egypt

props.synopsis: Ismaili mourners marched as bells rang during the burial ceremony in Egypt’s southern Aswan province.

title.children: Aga Khan makes final journey to resting place on banks of Nile

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: An e-scooter on fire on a suburban road at night.

props.synopsis: Fire and Rescue NSW has responded to 13 lithium-ion battery fires since February 2.

title.children: More than one battery fire breaking out every day in NSW this month

image.altText: The blast furnace at the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: As well as the debt to SA Water, GFG Alliance has not made any royalty payments to the government this financial year, according to a senior public servant who says there are "concerns around solvency" for the troubled industrial plant.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks' owner GFG owes about '$15 million' to SA Water

image.altText: E-WASTE LAPTOP GENERIC

props.synopsis: Australia produces 500,000 tonnes of e-waste a year but only about half of it is recycled. There are concerns Microsoft's decision to end support for its Windows 10 operating system later this year, which could affect 240 million computers globally, will worsen the problem.

title.children: Microsoft's Windows 10 move could drive landfill surge

image.altText: Abbey McGregor wearing a brown hat and white shirt standing outside

props.synopsis: More than a third of Australians are still working from home, defying a renewed push to get people back into the office post-pandemic.

title.children: Less than half believe WFH is productive but the conversation is nuanced

image.altText: Older woman wearing blue shirt sitting in car looking out front window.

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of retired renters are in poverty, according to new analysis from the Grattan Institute, with calls for the major parties to increase Rent Assistance to ease the burden.

title.children: Nearly 4 in 5 retired single women who rent are below the poverty line

image.altText: three school kids running through grounds

props.synopsis: From hair length to skirt length, school uniform policies, or dress codes, dictate many aspects of a student's appearance. But how enforceable are they?

title.children: Can schools enforce uniform policies like short hair for boys and skirts for girls?

image.altText: A monkey walks on main power lines

props.synopsis: Sri Lanka's energy minister says a monkey "came in contact" with a grid transformer in the south of the capital Colombo.

title.children: A monkey is being blamed for a nationwide blackout in Sri Lanka

image.altText: A young boy in a t-shirt that says 'lawnmower boys'

props.synopsis: The death of Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey will be thrust back into the spotlight today with the scheduled start of the trial of his four alleged murderers in WA's Supreme Court.

title.children: Four people accused of murdering Cassius Turvey to stand trial today

image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a house painted in green.

props.synopsis: NT police have arrested a man after his partner died in an alleged domestic violence incident in Alice Springs on Sunday.

title.children: Man arrested after woman dies in 'sustained' attack in Alice Springs

image.altText: People entering and exiting a subway.

props.synopsis: Many American cities have dire public transport systems, but it hasn't always been this way. How did they get so bad and how does Australia compare?

title.children: The reason public transport in American cities is so bad

image.altText: Elon Musk raises his hands to his sunglasses as Donald Trump, wearing a MAGA cap, stands behind him.

props.synopsis: US president Donald Trump fends off criticism of Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency, saying it will find "hundreds of billions" of US dollars in waste and fraud.

title.children: Trump defends work of Elon Musk's DOGE

image.altText: A man stands in front of a tank near Tiananmen Square.

props.synopsis: Behind every unforgettable image lies a lesser-known story — of the people depicted, the events that shaped them, and the photographers who created history.

title.children: The surprising stories behind the world's most iconic photographs

image.altText: Aerial view of flooded houses on an island.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Australians could be forced to leave their island homes under government plans to safeguard residents against rising sea levels.

title.children: Islanders' fury at 'unbelievable' call for climate change retreat

image.altText: Election officials counting votes on a table

props.synopsis: Just a few hundred votes separate the Labor and Liberal candidates in a by-election in Melbourne's west.

title.children: Postal votes could determine tight Werribee by-election

image.altText: The side of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has released its revised budget estimates, showing a significant blowout in forecast debt, but the Treasurer has ruled making significant changes to its fiscal approach.

title.children: Tasmanian budget debt to hit $9.6 billion by 2027-28

image.altText: fresh fruit in aisles of a grocery shop

props.synopsis: With grocery prices in remote communities costing double on average compared to capital cities, the federal government will lock the price of 30 essential products in remote stores to city prices.

title.children: Albanese promises to lock grocery prices in remote stores to city prices

image.altText: Lucy Liu stands at a house window looking serious

props.synopsis: Lucy Liu stars as a mother with a secret in a haunting ghost story with a twist in Presence, directed by the award-winning Steven Soderbergh.

title.children: This may be the first horror convincingly told from a ghost's point of view
